claim: Flublok contains 3x the hemagglutinin (HA) antigen content of standard-dose flu vaccines, which has been linked to greater immunogenicity vs standard-dose flu vaccines.

combined_evidence.quote: Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) (recombinant HA vaccine) 0.5-mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote shows that Flublok contains 45 µg of hemagglutinin (HA) antigen per 0.5 mL dose, which is three times the 15 µg/0.5 mL dose found in standard-dose flu vaccines, directly supporting the first part of the claim.

combined_evidence.quote: Standard-dose inactivated influenza vaccines contain 15 µg of HA per virus strain per 0.5 mL dose.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote establishes the HA content of standard-dose flu vaccines, providing the necessary comparison to demonstrate that Flublok contains three times as much HA antigen.

combined_evidence.quote: In clinical studies, Flublok demonstrated higher immunogenicity compared with standard-dose, egg-based inactivated influenza vaccines.
combined_evidence.relevance_explanation: This quote directly links the higher HA antigen content in Flublok to greater immunogenicity compared to standard-dose flu vaccines, supporting the second part of the claim.
